sectionText: The course will teach the principles behind the methods for classical problems in Bioinformatics, focusing on sequence alignment, genome assembly, and phylogeny estimation. In addition, the course will teach classical computer science problems and how to design and analyze algorithms for computational problems. The course involves a final project, in which students will use bioinformatics tools to analyze biological datasets.  This course includes significant programming assignments and students are expected to have a programming background before taking this course. Pre-requisites include: CS 125 (preferred) or CS 101.
